param.name: workspace
param.dialogReference: This is the general path or geodatabase where the work will take place.
param.pythonReference: This is the general path or geodatabase where the work will take place.

param.name: dem
param.dialogReference: This is the raster layer providing topographic and bathymetric data.
param.pythonReference: This is the raster layer providing topographic and bathymetric data.

param.name: polygons
param.dialogReference: This is a polygon layer whose geometry describes the maximum extents of the tidegates' influence.
param.pythonReference: This is a polygon layer whose geometry describes the maximum extents of the tidegates' influence.

param.name: ID_column
param.dialogReference: This is the column in the Zones of Influence Layer that links a zone of influence to its tidegate.
param.pythonReference: This is the column in the Zones of Influence Layer that links a zone of influence to its tidegate.

param.name: flood_output
param.dialogReference: Filename to which the flooded areas will be saved.
param.pythonReference: Filename to which the flooded areas will be saved.

param.name: wetlands
param.dialogReference: This is a polygon layer whose geometry describes potentially impacted wetlands.
param.pythonReference: This is a polygon layer whose geometry describes potentially impacted wetlands.

param.name: wetland_output
param.dialogReference: Filename to which the flooded wetlands will be saved.
param.pythonReference: Filename to which the flooded wetlands will be saved.

param.name: buildings
param.dialogReference: This is a polygon layer whose geometry describes potentially impacted buildings.
param.pythonReference: This is a polygon layer whose geometry describes potentially impacted wetlands.

param.name: building_output
param.dialogReference: Filename to which the flooded buildings will be saved.
param.pythonReference: Filename to which the flooded buildings will be saved.

scriptExample.title: Standard scenarios example
scriptExample.para: Demonstrates how to evaluate all standard scenarios in python
scriptExample.code:
import tidegates from tidegates import utils
workspace = r'F:\phobson\Tidegates\MB_Small.gdb' flooder = tidegates.toolbox.StandardScenarios()
with utils.WorkSpace(workspace), utils.OverwriteState(True): flooder._execute( workspace=workspace, dem=r'dem_x08', polygons=r'ZOI', wetlands=r'wetlands', buildings=r'buildings', ID_column='GeoID', flood_output='SS_flood', building_output='SS_bldg', wetland_output='SS_wetland', )
